title: As a child I took my grandmother for granted. Now she's 99, I realise how extraordinary she is
text:
For the past 25 years, I have been saying goodbye to my grandparents. It's the kind of heightened farewell that could grace the ­final moments of a Hollywood weepie: suffocating hug, meaningful eye contact, bottom lip trembling. They would watch me descend their building’s three flights before quickly repositioning themselves at the kitchen window to wave me off one last time, a final shared glimpse before – well, before the inevitable happened.

They were in their 70s, and I my 20s, when our goodbyes took on this dramatic tint; they living in a suburb of Milan, I the weekend visitor from London plugged into iPod earbuds, enjoying our time together but also keen to get back home, to work and real...
description: For the past 25 years, I have been saying goodbye to my grandparents.
